categories.title: Recent Updates and Fixes in ElizaOS

content.text: Fixed the Twitter plugin prompt to ensure it returns JSON.
Released version 0.1.8.build.1, merging development changes into the main branch.
Fixed a missing LETZAI model issue.
Added a Persian translation for the README file.
Fixed issues in release 0.1.8.
Prepared for version 0.1.8 release by merging development changes into the main branch.
Performed linting and fixed various issues in the codebase.
Added a mention deduplication utility for the Twitter client.
Inserted missing 'langdetect' dependency in the plugin-tts package.json.
Replaced an invalid Together AI medium model.
Added a Greek translation for the README file.
Refactored the NFT plugin.
Added tests for the WhatsApp plugin.
Added tests for the Coinbase plugin.
Renamed 'ai16z' to 'elizaOS' across the project.
The Together AI medium model referenced in the ElizaOS repository is invalid and does not exist. Attempts to use it result in errors, and it needs to be replaced with a valid model.
A GitHub client enumeration issue was identified, causing an 'Invalid enum value' error. A fix was implemented by adding 'GITHUB' to the client enumeration.
Eliza fails to join Discord voice channels upon request, throwing a 'ReferenceError: VoiceManager is not defined'. However, it successfully joins when starting up while already in a voice channel.

A login attempt error occurs when running a character on a Linux Ubuntu setup, despite working fine on macOS. The error message indicates incorrect credentials, though all parameters were correctly set in the .env file.

Using the '@elizaos/plugin-image-generation' plugin causes a database connection error, even though the plugin does not directly interact with the database. The issue appears to stem from the core's participant management system.
An ESLint version bump was implemented to prevent crashes.
Tests were added for the WhatsApp plugin, covering text message sending, template messages, error handling, webhook verification, message event handling, status updates, and empty event handling.
The SttTtsPlugin crashes when launching a Twitter Space, despite being enabled in the configuration. The error logs indicate an issue with the plugin's initialization.
Building a Docker image for Eliza fails with an exit code 137 on an M1 MacBook. The error occurs during the build process, specifically with the '@elizaos/adapter-sqljs' package.
A 'pnpm outdated lockfile' error occurs due to discrepancies between 'pnpm-lock.yaml' and 'package.json'. The issue prevents installation with 'frozen-lockfile' enabled.
Launching a character fails due to a 'ragKnowledge' error, indicating an undefined property. The issue prevents the agent from starting properly.
The Echochambers plugin does not work, throwing a 'Cannot find package' error when added to a character card. The issue persists despite proper configuration in the .env file.
@dankvr engaged in multiple conversations, mentioning being busy and forgetting about a post, offering to message someone later, and agreeing to send messages.
@0xwitchy requested a fix for a bright blue color affecting their eyes and mentioned needing pictures and diagrams for a project.
A JSON issue was fixed per masterdai's request.
Converted imageDescriptionsArray from 'let' to 'const' per linting requirements.
Moved uuid.tests to the correct __tests__ directory.

The latest cryptocurrency prices show fluctuations across various assets. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) is trading around $94,351 to $94,392. Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) has a price range between $3,265 and $3,282. Solana (SOL) is valued between $187.95 and $188.37. The ai16z token has seen a decrease, moving from $1.15 to $1.05.

categories.title: Recent Updates and Discussions in Crypto and Open-Source Development

content.text: @Rodairos, @dabit3, and @shawmakesmagic are performing well, as highlighted in a recent post.

A discussion on privacy-focused alternatives to Google Chrome and Docs in the crypto space. Recommendations include @brave for browsing and @hackmdio or @fileverse for collaborative document editing, both supporting markdown, which is beneficial for LLMs.
Eliza, initially a solo project, gained traction in the attention economy before launching a token. It now has hundreds of contributors, with no VC funding and a fair launch.
A proposal to create a workgroups repository where each group starts with a dedicated folder.
A contributor mentions being distracted from completing a task but commits to submitting more pull requests.
A recent commit includes various fixes and improvements, such as linting, dependency updates, security enhancements for file uploads, and a Persian README addition.
A fix was implemented for deepseek support in getTokenForProvider.

categories.title: Recent Updates and Fixes in ElizaOS

content.text: A fix was implemented to correct the SUI/USD price calculation by properly converting the price from the Dexscreener API response. Instead of using `priceUsd` directly, the correct approach is to take the inverse of `priceNative` to get the accurate SUI price in USD.

Support for DeepSeek API was completed in `getTokenForProvider`, ensuring proper API key handling. This update allows seamless integration with DeepSeek's OpenAI-compatible language models. Additionally, a bug fix was applied to address a missing API key setting, ensuring the API key is correctly retrieved when using DeepSeek as a model provider.

A new feature was introduced to support Twitter client functionality, including posting photos, automatic retweets, and likes based on keywords. API authentication was integrated, and documentation was updated to guide configuration and environment variable setup.

New API integration methods were added to the NFT collections service, including `getOwnedNFTs` to fetch owned NFTs, `createListing` to list NFTs on the Reservoir marketplace, and `getFloorListings` to retrieve floor listings for a collection. These updates include improved error handling and performance monitoring.
A fix was applied to remove redundant UUID conversion and add input parameter validations to the API server, improving stability and preventing potential issues.

categories.title: ElizaOS v0.1.8 Release and New Features

content.text: ElizaOS v0.1.8 has been released, introducing several major features. The update includes text-to-speech support in over 15 languages, image descriptions for client-twitter, and new AI providers such as Mistral AI, DeepSeek AI, and Cloudflare AI Gateway. Additionally, the release brings Intel SGX secure enclave support, a Pro API, and trending coin tracking.
A fix has been implemented to replace an invalid Together AI medium model with a valid one. This bug fix ensures that the correct model is used, improving system reliability.

A new Chainbase plugin has been added to Eliza, enabling AI agents to access and analyze blockchain data across multiple networks using natural language queries. This feature enhances Eliza's capabilities by providing real-time blockchain insights. The update includes documentation changes, testing procedures, and deployment instructions.
@fere_ai is developing a Telegram summarizer and working on a Discord summarizer, which may be useful for users looking for summarization tools.

categories.title: Recent Development Updates and Bug Fixes

content.text: Recent development efforts have focused on package improvements, new features, and bug fixes. Notable improvements include adding tests for the Coinbase plugin and setting file nesting for Markdown and DockerFile in VSCode. A total of 28 contributors merged 11 pull requests.

A bug fix was implemented to insert the missing 'langdetect' dependency in the 'plugin-tts' package.json file. This resolved an issue preventing successful builds. The fix was tested and verified with 87 successful tasks.
Version 0.1.8 was released with fixes, including resolving an issue with 'pnpm docker' by updating the 'plugin-quai' TypeScript configuration. This ensures the Docker build image functions correctly.

Further development included package improvements such as modifying prompts to ensure JSON output, introducing an NFT plugin, and addressing six bug fixes. A total of 38 contributors merged 22 pull requests.
A new integration has been introduced for the Livepeer LLM provider. This update aims to enhance the system's capabilities by incorporating Livepeer's services.
A new character, Nayari, has been added to the system. This feature update enhances the user experience by introducing a new interactive element.
A fix has been implemented to address an issue in the system. The details of the fix were not specified, but it contributes to overall stability and performance improvements.

categories.title: Fixes and Improvements for PostgreSQL Adapter in ElizaOS

content.text: A bug fix was implemented to resolve an issue with the new ragKnowledge feature when using PostgreSQL. The fix addresses UUID errors that occurred when attempting to use the feature in the knowledge section of the character file. This change ensures that the feature is now functional.

An additional fix was made to the PostgreSQL adapter migration process to prevent errors when creating an extension that already exists. This change improves the initial setup process for PostgreSQL, ensuring a smoother installation experience.
A specific fix was applied to the PostgreSQL chunk UUID handling for the ragKnowledge feature. This resolves formatting issues and ensures proper functionality.

A fix was introduced to prevent errors during the PostgreSQL adapter migration process by ensuring that an extension is not recreated if it already exists. This change reduces setup issues and improves database initialization.
